name: exquisitely
content:
exquisitely adverb
(BEAUTIFULLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a very beautiful and delicate way: Their house is exquisitely furnished. Exquisitely dressed couples stroll the streets.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was growing into an exquisitely beautiful woman.The dial of the clock is exquisitely decorated with a map of the world.The exquisitely shot Australian landscape is almost as breathtaking as the costumes.

exquisitely adverb
(SHARPLY)
literary in a way that is very extreme: an exquisitely painful disease Is there a more exquisitely melancholy sound than that of children crying?
More examplesFewer examplesThe most exquisitely foolish part of the book is the section about diet.There are some people that are very exquisitely sensitive to any pinprick or touch.In an exquisitely heartbreaking reunion between Ann and Lila, he allows his great ladies to carry the burden.
